Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2009 09:06AM Vavoom10 wrote: Hello Tim, everyone: Yes, it causes me to be very hungry too.  I find that shortly after I eat, about an hour and I will want to eat again.  I am on a therapy of A/C of which I am on my last one coming up, then it is 4 of T.  I would prefer not to have the steroids and have considered asking the nurse not to give it to me during my last infusion of A/C.  I was told by the nurse that the reason it is given is to make the anti nausea drug, Emend, work better.  I am given a drip of Emend and a shot of steroid before the A/C drip is given.  After my first treatment of A/C, I was given scripts to get two doses of emend and steroids and some anti nausea pills for the duration.  I was instructed to take emend and steroids for two days after treatment.  I did as instructed the first time.  Honestly, I think it prolonged my feelings of crappiness.  Since then I have not taken either drug after treatment and I felt better.  But, that's me.  Everyone is different.  I take the anti nausea med if my nausea bothers me, but honestly, the nausea has not been that severe for me.  I also found that the steroid caused me to have a lot of acid reflux for about a week.
